Reviews.Title: “Nice, sober and cool place”
Reviews.Author: Dina009
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a long 2 months stay for my business tip to San Diego California. The hotel offers great comforts and was an ideal match for me for its proximity to my office. I was surprised with the service that the hotel provides. Menu for the breakfast is awesome, offering a wide variety of things to choose from. The staff were very friendly and often ready to help. The room was really luxurious and I opted for for a one bedroom suite with a decent size kitchen. Kitchen is an important priority for me as I am a strict vegetarian and prefer cooking my own food. Room had 2 lcd tvs , a mini dining table and a sofa set to complete the set. All in all, the acoustics of the room was very sound and pleasing. In addition to it,the hotel offered an additional social hour sacks and some beer four days a week. The hotel had ample parking facility. I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: ScarfGirl85
Reviews.Content: This is a great mid-level hotel for staying in the business/Qualcomm area of San Diego. Having stayed 60+ nights at this hotel, the service has always been impeccable. The gentleman who takes care of the evening buffet is extremely pleasant, helpful, and kind - he cares about the patrons and has a terrific attitude. The front desk is extremely professional. In terms of cons, the hotel hallways have an interesting smell and the internet is excruciatingly slow during peak hours . However, the housekeeping has been good and the proximity to Yogurtland is a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get what I paid for”
Reviews.Author: batacbabyboomer
Reviews.Content: It was a last minute reservation on a Labor Day weekend. Got the room I wanted but for the price, I missed not having a small bottle of hand lotion that usually comes with the shampoo and conditioner. Breakfast was good. Room was great and staff was courteous and hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Base for San Diego Area Vacation”
Reviews.Author: MojoDad
Reviews.Content: We vacationed in San Diego for 8 days this summer and made the Residence Inn in Mira Mesa our home base. There are five of us, so we like the larger suites that are available in Mariott's Residence Inn. Room: We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit, which is definitely more like an apartment than a hotel room. Plenty of adequate space. It's the second time we used this chain, and they are very much alike. The only bad part was the volume of the A/C unit, which we could tell was the same for the entire complex. Location: It's located 15 minutes north of San Diego (Balboa Park, Sea World) and maybe 20 minutes south of Carlsbad (Lego Land). It was really conveniently located, just a few blocks off of I-805. The area is a large commercial business park and afternoon "5 o'clock whistle" traffic exiting the area was thick. Otherwise, it was a really great spot. Extras: The complimentary breakfast is really a plus. There's fresh eggs, sausage, hashbrowns, oatmeal, fresh waffles, etc. etc. The pool is average but adequate. I'd definitely recommend this place for families on vacation or for business travelers on extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Stay”
Reviews.Author: Megami76
Reviews.Content: My husband had enough Marriott points to get us a free room here for two nights when we went to visit my brother and attend his wedding. For free, it was pretty good and did the job. It was clean, the location was perfect for what we needed, and it had the free breakfast, which was nice. The bed is really really firm, though. It killed my back. The towels and toiletries are lackluster, but that's okay. I'm sure this place is good for families who need something a little more like a house. The staff was very kind to us (although my husband is a platinum member so that probably helped), and always responded to our requests quickly. The only problem is that there aren't any good restaurants nearby -- this is strictly for the crowd that is here for a purpose (knows someone who lives nearby or on business) -- I wouldn't stay here if you're a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at this Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: slctravelagent
Reviews.Content: Extended family stayed at this Residence Inn in May for several days. Had two one-bedroom units. Both very clean and well-maintained. A/C was a bit noisy -- too bad it was housed in a "closet" in the bedroom. But didn't interrupt sleep. Breakfast was wonderful -- lots of choices and well stocked. Plenty of seating space as well. All employees from front desk to maintenance were friendly and helpful. Beds were a bit firm for our liking, but all in all a wonderful stay. As a travel agent, I'll be recommending this property to my clients, unless they have to be in the downtown area, as this is a bit out of the way. There are several restaurants and shops in the nearby area, however. We loved our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “No Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: tigerlily714612
Reviews.Content: 1. They allow pets in this hotel without leashes. 2. There are rats in the dumpster. 3. The beds are old and uncomfortable. 4. The front desk is indifferent if they speak English. 5. Noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Schweger
Reviews.Content: This property is in a nice industrial area. It's pretty deserted on the weekend but crazy during the workweek. You will need a rental car to get around. We stayed in Unit 214 (a one bedroom suite) in June 2007. We asked for a quiet room so our room faced the parking lot. The room was very clean and housekeeping did a great job every day. Our room was next door to the laundry facility, which was very convenient. The kitchen was clean and had a small amount of dishes. The bedroom was very small, you can just walk around the bed. There is no extra space in there. But, the bed was comfortable and there were five pillows! There was a tv in the living room and a tv in the bedroom. Yes, the ac unit in the bedroom was noisy. But, I am a very light sleeper and it did not wake me up when it turned off and on. There was adequate free parking and the pool was clean. The breakfast was very good, except the eggs were runny and the coffee was really strong! The staff was friendly and helpful. The elevator was terribly slow so we just took the stairs. There was a good amount of information in our room about nearby restaurants, grocery stores, etc. which was very helpful given the cruddy map we had received from the rental car agency. On the day we were leaving, we asked for a later checkout time (normal checkout time is 12:00) and we were given an additional hour which gave us time to hit the beach for a little bit before we had to leave. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: gmwann
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Residence Inn Sorrento Mesa. As a long time Trip Advisor user, I researched a number of hotels before settling on a property for our first San Diego visit. I booked a good rate directly thru the hotel website. This Residence Inn lived up to its good reviews. We received a friendly welcome upon arrival. We were somewhat concerned as we pulled into the parking lot to see a very large portable generator humming along right next to the lobby. When we checked in we found out that the local utility company shut down power to many local businesses for the first two days of our stay and the hotel obtained a generator so as not to inconvenience guests. The generator was obviously up to the job, because we didn't notice any problems. We had a one bedroom queen suite which was spacious enough for the 3 or us. My 10 year old slept on the sleeper sofa and it was of better quality than many sleepers or rollaways we've had to use before. It would probably fit two children or one adult comfortably. Our bed was very comfortable and having the kitchen (full size fridge, microwave and dishwasher) was a plus. The pool and hot tub were great after a long day of seeing the sights! The property had a mix of families and business travelers. The complimentary breakfast was definitely a step above the standard "continental" fare with scrambled eggs, waffles, hashbrowns and variations of sausages, biscuits and gravy and croissants in additional to the more traditional offerings. The property is a good ways from downtown, but with a rental car it was still very convenient to all of the sights (about 15 minutes to each of the major attractions). A good map (or get directions on the complimentary internet access!) and it was pretty easy to get around! Our only complaint (and the ONLY reason we did not rate the property an Excellent) was that the airconditioning unit was pretty loud. The rooms were all very quiet and we didn't hear anything of our neighbors, but at night when the AC cycled on it was enough to wake both my husband and I. We tried turning it off, but the room was too stuffy, so ended up leaving the AC running all night. It was still a bit loud and took some getting used to, but was preferrable to being startled awake each time it kicked on! Overall, it was a great stay and we would definitely book there for future visits to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: adamgoldman60611
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to stay at another extended stay property about 1/2 mile down the street for 2 months, but convinced my company into letting me stay at Residence, and boy am I glad. I have been here at the hotel for about 2 weeks now, and the service is top notch. They feed me every morning and on Mon thru Thur evening they have a reception with great food, cold beer and a great way to meet the family I will be living with for the next 2 months. I inquired about a grocery store, since I have a kitchen and they said to just leave a list of what I needed and they will gladly go shopping for me. I did this, came home at 3p from the office and it was all put away in my kitchen. What service. My room, wow, has a fire place, two bedrooms, two baths a great kitchen and is quiet, all for a rate a lot less than any other hotel in the area. If you are looking for a place to live for a while, I highly suggest staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great Room and More”
Reviews.Author: CMH-JFK
Reviews.Content: You could tell this hotel was outstanding when we checked in. The staff was nice and very welcoming. When we got in the room, we were surprised. The room was new and big with a kitchen. In the morning the breakfast was delicious. You can make your own waffles and they had sausage, eggs, cereal, yogurt, ect. In the evening Mon-Thurs there was a manager's reception that included a little meal and free drinks (pop, wine, beer). The meal was enough for us to be our dinner. I wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: AquaMom
Reviews.Content: My husband, 20-month old son, and I just stayed nine nights at this Residence Inn. Our son has a rare metabolic disorder which requires us to prepare special foods for him, some of which require the use of either a conventional oven or a toaster oven. Just prior to our arrival, my husband inquired about whether the one-bedroom suite we had reserved has one or both, but unfortunately, it has only a microwave oven (which was a big help for other food we had to prepare) and a toaster. When my husband then explained the reason for our inquiry and asked whether there was a Target or Wal-Mart nearby where we could buy a toaster oven, they amazingly offered to go out and buy a toaster oven for us to use. Upon our arrival, we received a warm welcome from the front desk staff, who said they were waiting for us - a new toaster oven/convection oven was already in our room, and a Graco pack-n-play was all set up for our son - both at no extra charge. We then went to their Thursday evening barbeque where the manager asked us if the oven and everything was OK. I cannot believe what personal assistance and attention we received! The front desk staff was always very helpful and friendly. The suite and property were very well maintained and clean. The carpeting in the suite looked brand new, and the bed was very comfortable. We were very pleased with the amount of space we had and the kitchen facility. The suite was much bigger than conventional hotel rooms. There was plenty of room to move around in the living area even with the pack-n-play. The kitchen area had a full-sized fridge with a freezer, dishwasher (which we didnâ€™t use), and a small sink, and the cabinets were filled with dishes, a toaster, pots and pans, utensils, etc. - just about everything you would need. Even paper towels were provided. Adjacent to the kitchen was a small dining table and two chairs, and that room also had a desk, sofa, chair, coffee table, and TV (but no DVD player - we brought our own portable player). The bedroom also had a TV. The furniture isnâ€™t fancy, but that isnâ€™t a priority for us. The housekeeping staff thoroughly cleaned our suite early each morning after we left, and they were very friendly and polite and very kind to our son. Our suite overlooked the pool and basketball/tennis court, but our rooms were still quiet enough for our son to fall asleep in the early evening when children and adults were outside playing and swimming. Our suite was next to the elevator - I wish they could turn down the volume of the â€œding dingâ€� that plays every time the elevator arrives. We slept so soundly though that it did not wake us up. The air conditioner is located in the bedroom and was a bit loud, although it too did not keep us awake. The parking spaces are a bit tight, but unlike other Residence Inns in the area, there was no separate parking charge. The breakfast buffet was free and much more extensive than I had expected. It certainly filled us up and saved us a lot of time and money each day. My husband enjoyed making the two of us Belgian waffles each morning - they sometimes even had blueberry or chocolate batter. Also available were muffins, donuts, bread, bagels, fruit (which was also available throughout the day), yogurt, scrambled eggs, potatoes, several types of cereal, three juices, coffee, skim and reduced-fat milk, and another hot selection such as biscuits and gravy, taco shells, pancakes, french toast, etc. Three high chairs were available for little ones. The staff members working in the â€œGatehouseâ€� during meal times were very friendly and kept the food replenished and the tables quickly cleared and cleaned. Light meals were available Monday through Thursday evenings. We particularly enjoyed the Thursday barbeques which included grilled burgers, veggie burgers, and hot dogs, potato salad, watermelon, chips, soft drinks, beer, and wine. Music was playing outside; the volume could be reduced so that it isnâ€™t so loud for those who are napping or working in their rooms. Another night there were french bread pizzas, which werenâ€™t the best - they could be baked longer, and salad. The next night they had meatball sandwiches and salad, which were fine after a long day at the Zoo and the beach (although rolls other than hamburger buns would be an improvement). After a long day it was nice to just grab something quick (and free) to eat. We went to the San Diego Zoo several times, having purchased a membership on-line a few weeks before, which is good for 14 months and is also good at the Wild Animal Park. Membership more than paid for itself with just those few visits. Given our sonâ€™s young age and the heat and humidity, we werenâ€™t able to stay at the Zoo or Animal Park all day, so it was great to have the membership card to come and go as we pleased. It took us only 25 minutes to drive to the Zoo each morning between 8:30 and 9:30. The Animal Park was just a 35-minute drive. Torrey Pines State Park beach was just 10 or 15 minutes away, except during evening rush hour when it could take about 20 minutes just to drive the short distance from the hotel to the highway, which was a bit frustrating. La Jolla beach was about a 20-minute drive. Beautiful Coronado beach was about 30 minutes away. The front desk gave us cards with directions to each destination, which was a big help. While I wish there was a kiddie pool, our son absolutely loved swimming in the fair-sized pool, which was never very crowded despite a soccer tournament group and other groups being there during our stay. Towels were available pool-side. The property is located in an office/commercial area, but it is not far off of the 805 and is centrally located to the various attractions and nice beaches. Two grocery stores (Vons and Ralphs) and a Target are a short drive away, and there are numerous restaurants and fast-food places within a short driving distance. The front desk even directed us to a nice public playground nearby, which our son loved. There was one computer available off of the lobby for guests to use, but the internet connection was so painfully slow that we did not use it. There were many other families there, with kids of all ages, and there were also business travelers present too. We were very pleased with our stay at this Residence Inn and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, useful features, but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: alexsndiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn Sorrento Valley in mid-January '06. I used my Marriott Reward points to cover a 3 night stay in a Queen Bed Studio Room. The hotel is currently being renovated. Our room was supposed to have been renovated but I thought the cabinets, tv, and dressers, etc were just average. Dont expect posh interiors. This was my first ever stay at a Residence Inn. Maybe I was expecting a little more. The hotel has a free evening managers reception (Monday thru Thursday, 5-7 pm) where they serve beer, wine, and a small entree. During our stay they served Chicken with Scalloped Potatoes and Chicken Parmesan on separate evenings. The food was okay but its FREE! A free continental breakfast buffet is served every monrning with Eggs, Waffles, Country Potatoes, etc. Menu items vary daily. Breakfast was ok, but hey its free. Rooms were clean. There is a swimming pool, jacuzzi, sport court, bbq grill, aerobic machines, and a ping pong table. Room has all you need in the kitchen utensils department (knives, silverware, plates, etc). One complaint was the bed. We were placed in a room with the older Marriott foam bed. It was not comfortable at all. We did not get a good nights sleep at all. The hotel is currently in the process of updating the beds with the newer Marriott Revive beds which are wonderful. My other complaint was the a/c unit is very noisy. In the Queen Studio its located in a closet adjacent to the bed. Not the best way to get a good nights sleep. Overall, the rooms were clean and spacious. However, ask for a room with the new Revive beds for a better night sleep. Dont expect luxury either. I will stick to full service Marriotts and Marriott Vacation Club units.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks in Feb '05 while on buisness in San Diego. Had no complaints. Everything and everyone worked fine,(well with the exception of the wafflemaker sticking one morning). Saved some of my per diem money with the breakfast and the evening receptions as well. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Brucen32
Reviews.Content: We stay here about 4 times a year. The hotel suite is spacious, including a separate kitchen, sitting area with L-shape sofa and coffee table, and a work area with table and chair. It is our favorite place as it's well-priced for a newer suite. It has heated outdoor pool, sports court and free continental breakfast. The only thing I would want is something with meat such as bacon or ham. But otherwise, many selections including oatmeal, eggs, cereals, juices, etc... The rooms are clean, quiet and if you drive about a mile or so there are a zillion (almost) restaurants and food choices and entertainment areas. The drive to Seaworld is not much more than 15-20 minutes because it is pretty much clear sailing traffic-wise. I highly recommend this hotel if you want more than just a small hotel room. You can relax and unwind after a day out and not be cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Purpose for Trip: Business Conference Looked at reviews for other hotels in area. Choose Staybridge Suites for my 5 day trip. Left there after one day. Called Marriott and asked them to help me out. Got an excellent room at a great price for the remainder of my stay - Thanks Huey (Marriott Regional Manager). Quiet, nice room, easy parking, good location. Great for business travelers and light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: AlphaRiss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Residence Inn over the Memorial Day weekend. When I initially reserved our 2 BDR suite, I have to admit that I was a bit worried about what I'd have waiting for me, given the condition of some of the Residence Inns I've seen of late. I must say, I was pleasantly surprised! The hotel was new (perhaps 3 yrs old), well-maintained, and clean. Instead of the traditional Residence Inns that look like old apartment buildings where entrances to suites are from the exterior, this one had interior corridors. I felt safer with this layout. Our suite was well-equipped. My kids enjoyed the courtyard amenities (such as the pool and ping pong). The breakfast buffet was ok - really nothing to rave about - just standard continental breakfast with some scrambled eggs, waffles, cereals, etc. You can't really complain since it was "complimentary". The staff for the most part was very courteous and friendly (with the exception of a front desk clerk who gave me a little attitude when I disputed a charge for the in-roon Nintendo that we didn't even touch). Aside from that, the staff was very willing to please and pleasant to deal with. I found the location to be pretty good. It was close to numerous restaurants (about 1-2 miles from a bunch of restaurants on Mira Mesa). It wasn't a bad drive (about 15-20 mins) to most of the tourist destinations (e.g., the zoo, beaches, downtown). I actually liked the fact that it was a little away from the hustle and bustle in the touristy areas. I would definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good suite hotel - close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Point2point
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a househunting trip and found it easy to drive north county inland & coastal pretty quickly. UTC 15 min. away, Del Mar 15 min. away, Mira Mesa restaurants 5 min., Penasquitos & Sabre Springs 20 min. Quiet area, but only a few restaurants in walking distance. Facing into the courtyard is probably quietest, although Bldg. A was not bad (we had a few trucks loading in the middle of the night at warehouse next door). Don't pick a room on Mira Mesa unless you like traffic. Staff was helpful & courteous. "Free" internet was only free for 2 days, then they charge $11.95 each day after that. We balked at the advertising and we were only charged for 1 day instead of 5. It's only free if you bring your own wireless card and don't need to borrow a wireless kit. The 1 bdr was fine for 2 people, but I'd feel claustrophobic with 2 young kids running around in it. The breakfast buffet had enough variety for our 6 day stay. Coffee could be better... Happy hour our first evening was basic sandwich fixings, and the server cheerily brought over beer & wine refills. We did not have time to sample the BBQ or other snacks that week. It was a very busy hotel, close to Miramar & many corporate offices so there was a good mix of people. Overall a comfortable stay for business reasons; there are probably better locations for touristy sightseeing.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn San Diego Sorrento Mesa/Sorrento Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 5995 Pacific Mesa Court, San Diego, CA 92121
